newsitem.title: USA: Colonial to acquire Great Southern for $22.6 million.
newsitem.headline: Colonial to acquire Great Southern for $22.6 million.

text.p: Colonial BancGroup, an Alabama-based banking company, has a definitive agreement to acquire Great Southern Bancorp in a stock deal worth about $22.6 million, the companies said Friday.
Under the agreement, Colonial will offer $13.05 worth of its stock for each Great Southern share outstanding, or a total of $20.76 million, in a tax-free pooling of interests.
In addition, Montgomery, Ala.-based Colonial will assume Great Southern options based on the $13.05 price per share.
Great Southern Bancorp's subsidiary, Great Southern Bank, will be merged into BancGroup's Florida bank and become a part of Colonial's South Florida region.
The parties had previously signed a letter of intent on Feb. 20.
The transaction is subject to approval by regulators and Great Southern's shareholders.
Great Southern, based in West Palm Beach, Fla., has assets of $120 million. It operates three offices in the greater West Palm Beach area and plans to open two more offices in April.
Colonial, a multi-bank holding company, has assets of $6 billion, including pending acquisitions, and 163 full service offices in Alabama, Florida, Georgia and Tennessee.
Great Southern's stock rose 87.5 cents to $18 on Nasdaq in late morning trading. Colonial gained 25 cents to $23 on the New York Stock Exchange.
